article.headline: Boston College 56, Virginia Tech 48
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Craig Smith scored seven of his 11 points in an 17-0 run late in the second half that carried Boston College past Virginia Tech 56-48 on Wednesday night. Jared Dudley had 14 points and Louis Hinnant scored 12 points for the Eagles (19-8, 8-6 Big East). Bryant Matthews, the conference's leading scorer at 22.6 points per game, had 21 points and eight rebounds for Virginia Tech (11-13, 4-9). BC trailed by seven midway into the second half before scoring its 17 unanswered points over a 8:04 stretch. Smith and Dudley combined for 11 points in the run, with Smith scoring seven and Dudley four. Hinnant added a 3-pointer. The Hokies closed it to 50-46 when Matthews was fouled on a 3-point field goal with 34.8 seconds left, but he missed the free throw and Dudley scored on a breakaway layup. The Eagles tied the game twice in the opening two minutes of the second half before the Hokies took a 40-33 lead on Matthews' jumper with just over 10 minutes left in the game. Virginia Tech, which led 25-20 at halftime, used a deliberate offense to run down the shot clock on nearly each possession.
